articles.headline: Putin Calls Talks a ‘Dead End’ but Limits War Aim to Eastern Ukraine
articles.snippet: It was the first time that President Vladimir Putin himself had defined a more limited military goal: taking control of the Donbas region in the east of Ukraine — not the whole country.
articles.abstract: It was the first time that President Vladimir Putin himself had defined a more limited military goal: taking control of the Donbas region in the east of Ukraine — not the whole country.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia said on Tuesday that peace talks with Ukraine had reached a “dead end” and he falsely called the evidence of Russian atrocities in a Kyiv suburb “fake,” using his first extended remarks about the war in nearly a month to insist that Russia would persist in its invasion.

articles.headline: Substack’s Growth Spurt Brings Growing Pains
articles.snippet: The publishing platform’s founders want Substack to be an “alternate universe on the internet.” But it faces copycat rivals, an exodus by writers and a need to move beyond newsletters.
articles.abstract: The publishing platform’s founders want Substack to be an “alternate universe on the internet.” But it faces copycat rivals, an exodus by writers and a need to move beyond newsletters.
articles.lead_paragraph: There are things that the newsletter writer Kirsten Han misses about Substack. They just aren’t enough to outweigh the downsides.

articles.headline: Russian Tech Industry Faces ‘Brain Drain’ as Workers Flee
articles.snippet: Since their country invaded Ukraine, Russian tech workers have left by the thousands. They appear intent on rebuilding their lives and businesses in other countries.
articles.abstract: Since their country invaded Ukraine, Russian tech workers have left by the thousands. They appear intent on rebuilding their lives and businesses in other countries.
articles.lead_paragraph: In early March, days after Russia invaded Ukraine and began cracking down on dissent at home, Konstantin Siniushin, a venture capitalist in Riga, Latvia, helped charter two planes out of Russia to help people flee.
articles.byline: By Cade Metz and Adam Satariano

articles.headline: China’s ‘Zero Covid’ Mess Proves Autocracy Hurts Everyone
articles.snippet: The fear in China is that the strict coronavirus policy has become another Mao-style political campaign with devastating effects.
articles.abstract: The fear in China is that the strict coronavirus policy has become another Mao-style political campaign with devastating effects.
articles.lead_paragraph: Long before the “zero Covid” policy, China had a “zero sparrow” policy.

articles.headline: McKinsey Opened a Door in Its Firewall Between Pharma Clients and Regulators
articles.snippet: The firm let consultants advise both drugmakers and their government overseers, internal records show. “Who we know and what we know” was part of their pitch.
articles.abstract: The firm let consultants advise both drugmakers and their government overseers, internal records show. “Who we know and what we know” was part of their pitch.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jeff Smith, a partner with the influential consulting firm McKinsey & Company, accepted a highly sensitive assignment in December 2017. The opioid manufacturer Purdue Pharma, beleaguered and in financial trouble, wanted to revamp its business, and an executive there sought out Dr. Smith.
articles.byline: By Chris Hamby, Walt Bogdanich, Michael Forsythe and Jennifer Valentino-DeVries

articles.headline: U.S. and Ukrainian Groups Pierce Putin’s Propaganda Bubble
articles.snippet: U.S.-backed news outlets and Ukrainian activists use Cold War techniques and high-tech tactics to get news about the war to Russians.
articles.abstract: U.S.-backed news outlets and Ukrainian activists use Cold War techniques and high-tech tactics to get news about the war to Russians.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Using a mix of high-tech and Cold War tactics, Ukrainian activists and Western institutions have begun to pierce the propaganda bubble in Russia, circulating information about the Ukraine war among Russian citizens to sow doubt about the Kremlin’s accounts.
articles.byline: By Julian E. Barnes and Edward Wong
